subject: Design
title: Change Blindness: What Users Miss
description: A quick, practical guide to Change Blindness: What Users Miss.

hook.text: A gorilla walks through a basketball game and half the viewers don't see it. Seriously.

buildup.text: Change blindness means humans miss even major visual changes when attention is elsewhere.

discovery.text: In UX, this means users won't notice updated content, moved buttons, or new features unless prompted.

twist.text: This is why apps use tooltips, badges, and animations â€” they force attention to changes users would miss.

climax.text: Designers must guide attention explicitly. Assuming users will notice changes is a costly mistake.

punchline.text: Users only see what you point at.

quiz.question: What is change blindness?
options: Failing to notice visual changes when attention is elsewhere
